issue.title: Clarify container destructor requirements w.r.t. std::array

discussion.p:
It has been suggested that Table 96 — "Container requirements" makes confusing requirements for the destructor of std::array:
"note: the destructor is applied to every element of a; all the memory is deallocated."
Since std::array obtains no memory, there is none to deallocate, arguably making it unclear what the requirement means for std::array::~array().

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N3691.

li.p: Change in , Table 96 — "Container requirements", the "Assertion/note/pre-/post-condition" for the expression "(&a)->~X()" as indicated:

blockquote.p: note: the destructor is applied to every element of a; all theany memory obtained is deallocated.
